condoning.question: Have I, through my words, failed to correct or admonish fellow Catholics who have deliberately avoided receiving Sacraments or attending Mass?

ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

greed.question: Have I made material possessions a driving force in my life, potentially leading me to prioritize them over trust in God's providence?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

extracted_data_phrases: such as luxury goods or excessive wealth
greed.question: Did I make acquiring material possessions, such as luxury goods or excessive wealth, my chief goal in life?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

extracted_data_phrases: in unjust and cruel exercises of power or authority , such as bullying , belittling , or demeaning others through my words , actions , or deeds
such as bullying , belittling , or demeaning others through my words , actions , or deeds
through my words , actions , or deeds
oppression.question: Did I engage in unjust and cruel exercises of power or authority, such as bullying, belittling, or demeaning others through my words, actions, or deeds?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

extracted_data_phrases: rather than seeing them as beloved sons and daughters of God
as beloved sons and daughters of God
lust.question: Did I reduce others to their usefulness, rather than seeing them as beloved sons and daughters of God?
lust.description: While not sexual in nature, this sin is still a form of lust in that it objectifies others who are created in God's image and possesses inherent dignity,

extracted_data_phrases: primarily as people who could meet my needs or fulfill my expectations rather than respecting their inherent dignity and worth
rather than respecting their inherent dignity and worth
lust.question: Did I see others, especially those in my life whom God has entrusted to me, primarily as people who could meet my needs or fulfill my expectations rather than respecting their inherent dignity and worth?
lust.description: While not sexual in nature, this sin is still a form of lust in that it objectifies others who are created in God's image and possesses inherent dignity,

extracted_data_phrases: with someone I am not married to
to lustful thoughts or desires towards another person
lust.question: Have I had actual or simulated sexual acts outside of marriage with someone I am not married to, or have I given in to lustful thoughts or desires towards another person?
lust.description: While our sexual nature is a gift, using it to indulge in sensual pleasures is sinful as it's ordered for a particular purpose within marriage.

autonomy.question: Did I attribute my accomplishments to my own efforts, forgetting that God's Providence guided my endeavors?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

autonomy.question: Have I taken credit for my accomplishments, forgetting to acknowledge God's hand in guiding me towards them?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

extracted_data_phrases: through unproductive or anxious thoughts about my life 's direction
autonomy.question: Did I, through unproductive or anxious thoughts about my life's direction, entertain doubts about God's existence?
autonomy.description: Deliberately entertaining doubts about God's existence is a sin against faith because it questions the most fundamental truth of our faith and shows a lack of trust in God's clear self-revelation through creation, scripture, and the Church's teachings.

extracted_data_phrases: without acknowledging God 's hand in all that I accomplish
autonomy.question: Did I solely rely on my own abilities without acknowledging God's hand in all that I accomplish?
autonomy.description: Pride is self-reliance repeats Lucifer's original sin of wanting independence from God and fails to acknowledge our complete dependence on divine grace.

autonomy.question: Did I allow my own abilities to overshadow God's will, leading me to believe that I can accomplish everything on my own?
autonomy.description: Pride is self-reliance repeats Lucifer's original sin of wanting independence from God and fails to acknowledge our complete dependence on divine grace.

extracted_data_phrases: in all that you have accomplished
autonomy.question: Did you lean solely on your own abilities, forgetting to recognize God's gracious assistance in all that you have accomplished?
autonomy.description: Pride is self-reliance repeats Lucifer's original sin of wanting independence from God and fails to acknowledge our complete dependence on divine grace.

incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control and use words that were hurtful or degrading to others?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

extracted_data_phrases: in an unseemly manner using profanity or coarse language
incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control and speak to others in an unseemly manner using profanity or coarse language, violating their dignity and potentially causing them harm?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable
to prioritizing family expenses over discretionary spending
gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, especially when it comes to prioritizing family expenses over discretionary spending?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

gluttony.question: Did you allow excessive eating or drinking to become an unnecessary distraction from your responsibilities, especially towards your family?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in speaking about others ' private matters
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in speaking about others' private matters, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in sharing others' private affairs, even if they were true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

gossip.question: Have I indulged in discussing others' personal matters, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: on a Sunday when it otherwise could be avoided ,
impiety.question: Did I involve others in work on a Sunday when it otherwise could be avoided, disrupting their day of rest?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).

extracted_data_phrases: for purposes other than those intended
impiety.question: Did I use my Sunday, which is a holy day of rest and a time to worship and protest against the servitude of work, for purposes other than those intended?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).

extracted_data_phrases: in our home or during family gatherings
impiety.question: Did I fail to show reverence for Most Blessed Sacrament, even when it was present in our home or during family gatherings?
impiety.description: This sin is in failing to show proper reverence demonstrates a lack of faith, respect, and proper worship due to God.

extracted_data_phrases: for the Most Blessed Sacrament during your family 's daily routines or special occasions
during your family 's daily routines or special occasions
impiety.question: Did you fail to show reverence for the Most Blessed Sacrament during your family's daily routines or special occasions?
impiety.description: This sin is in failing to show proper reverence demonstrates a lack of faith, respect, and proper worship due to God.

extracted_data_phrases: by neglecting to give due respect during solemn liturgical celebrations or Eucharistic processions
during solemn liturgical celebrations or Eucharistic processions
impiety.question: Did I fail to show reverence for Most Blessed Sacrament by neglecting to give due respect during solemn liturgical celebrations or Eucharistic processions, especially when accompanied by family members?
impiety.description: This sin is in failing to show proper reverence demonstrates a lack of faith, respect, and proper worship due to God.

impurity.question: Did you use practices to prevent pregnancy?
impurity.description: This sin intentionally separates the unitive and procreative purposes of marriage and violates the proper use of one's sexuality.

impurity.question: Did you use practices, substances, or objects to prevent conception in your marriage?
impurity.description: This sin intentionally separates the unitive and procreative purposes of marriage and violates the proper use of one's sexuality.

extracted_data_phrases: in a way that dishonors my dignity
impurity.question: Have I worn attire that is immodest in a way that dishonors my dignity?
impurity.description: Wearing attire that's exceptionally revealing or indecent violates chastity and beckons sins from others.

impurity.question: Have I worn attire that is immodestly revealing, thereby offending my own dignity?
impurity.description: Wearing attire that's exceptionally revealing or indecent violates chastity and beckons sins from others.

infidelity.question: Did you intentionally do anything that would cause your marriage vows to be broken?
infidelity.description: Fidelity in marriage is viewed as a sacred covenant made before God - not just a contract between people, thus breaking vows is seen as a betrayal of both divine and human trust.

extracted_data_phrases: in ways that brought pain or suffering to someone else , perhaps through my own thoughtlessness or intentional actions
perhaps through my own thoughtlessness or intentional actions
violence.question: Have I knowingly acted in ways that brought pain or suffering to someone else, perhaps through my own thoughtlessness or intentional actions?
violence.description: When we deliberately harm others, we attack their God-given dignity.

extracted_data_phrases: in ways that have intentionally caused harm or pain to someone else through my words , actions , or decisions
through my words , actions , or decisions
violence.question: Have I knowingly acted in ways that have intentionally caused harm or pain to someone else through my words, actions, or decisions?
violence.description: When we deliberately harm others, we attack their God-given dignity.

extracted_data_phrases: through my words , actions , or decisions
violence.question: Have I knowingly caused pain, suffering, or harm to someone else through my words, actions, or decisions?
violence.description: When we deliberately harm others, we attack their God-given dignity.

envy.question: Have I allowed dissatisfaction with my own blessings to manifest in coveting others' possessions?
envy.description: This sin stems from ingratitude for one's own blessings and letting material desires control our hearts.

extracted_data_phrases: in taking an innocent human life through abortion or euthanasia
murder.question: Have I intentionally participated in taking an innocent human life through abortion or euthanasia?
murder.description: It's a grave sin to actively participate in the intentional taking of another's life, which robs the gift of life that was granted to others by God.

extracted_data_phrases: with mediums , fortune tellers , tarot card readers , or
sorcery.question: Have I communicated with mediums, fortune tellers, tarot card readers, or used Ouija boards?
sorcery.description: This sin is a violation of the First Commandment because it attempts to bypass God's providence and divine will by seeking supernatural knowledge through forbidden means, effectively placing trust in occult practices rather than in God.

extracted_data_phrases: in any conversations or discussions that involved mediums , fortune tellers , tarot card readers , or Ouija boards
sorcery.question: Did I engage in any conversations or discussions that involved mediums, fortune tellers, tarot card readers, or Ouija boards?
sorcery.description: This sin is a violation of the First Commandment because it attempts to bypass God's providence and divine will by seeking supernatural knowledge through forbidden means, effectively placing trust in occult practices rather than in God.

extracted_data_phrases: with anyone who claims to receive supernatural guidance through occult practices , such as tarot card readings or communicating with spirits
through occult practices , such as tarot card readings or communicating with spirits
such as tarot card readings or communicating with spirits
sorcery.question: Have I communicated or associated with anyone who claims to receive supernatural guidance through occult practices, such as tarot card readings or communicating with spirits?
sorcery.description: This sin is a violation of the First Commandment because it attempts to bypass God's providence and divine will by seeking supernatural knowledge through forbidden means, effectively placing trust in occult practices rather than in God.

extracted_data_phrases: without making any effort to change
presumption.question: Have you deliberately persisted in sinful behavior, counting on God's mercy without making any effort to change, even when circumstances or opportunities presented themselves?
presumption.description: Presumption of God's mercy is a sin against hope because it takes His forgiveness for granted without true repentance or effort to amend one's life, showing disrespect for divine justice and mercy.

extracted_data_phrases: in taking God 's mercy for granted
without making any effort to change your life or grow spiritually
presumption.question: Have you deliberately persisted in taking God's mercy for granted, counting on it without making any effort to change your life or grow spiritually?
presumption.description: Presumption of God's mercy is a sin against hope because it takes His forgiveness for granted without true repentance or effort to amend one's life, showing disrespect for divine justice and mercy.

extracted_data_phrases: without making any sincere effort to change your thoughts , words , or actions
presumption.question: Did you recklessly assume God's mercy without making any sincere effort to change your thoughts, words, or actions?
presumption.description: Presumption of God's mercy is a sin against hope because it takes His forgiveness for granted without true repentance or effort to amend one's life, showing disrespect for divine justice and mercy.

presumption.question: Did you put off going to confession while in a state of sin, assuming that God would forgive your delay?
presumption.description: Deliberately delaying confession while in mortal sin is a serious offense because it recklessly endangers your soul's salvation, shows contempt for God's mercy through the sacrament of reconciliation, and demonstrates prideful presumption that you'll have time later to repent.

presumption.question: Did you put off going to confession while in a state of sin, assuming you would have time later to make amends?
presumption.description: Deliberately delaying confession while in mortal sin is a serious offense because it recklessly endangers your soul's salvation, shows contempt for God's mercy through the sacrament of reconciliation, and demonstrates prideful presumption that you'll have time later to repent.

resistance of truth.question: Did you entertain doubts about God's existence in your thoughts, especially when faced with uncertainty or difficulties that may have tested your faith?
resistance of truth.description: Deliberately entertaining doubts about God's existence is a sin against faith because it questions the most fundamental truth of our faith and shows a lack of trust in God's clear self-revelation through creation, scripture, and the Church's teachings.

extracted_data_phrases: either internally to yourself or by sharing your doubts with others
apostasy.question: Have you ever explicitly rejected the existence of God, either internally to yourself or by sharing your doubts with others?
apostasy.description: Denying God's existence after having been baptized apostasy is one of the gravest sins possible because it is declaring the Author of Life and Source of all being to be non-existent, which directly contradicts both reason and divine revelation.

extracted_data_phrases: either internally through thought or to others through word
apostasy.question: Have you explicitly rejected the existence of God, either internally through thought or to others through word?
apostasy.description: Denying God's existence after having been baptized apostasy is one of the gravest sins possible because it is declaring the Author of Life and Source of all being to be non-existent, which directly contradicts both reason and divine revelation.

extracted_data_phrases: either through internal doubts or external declarations , in your thoughts and reflections about faith
in your thoughts and reflections about faith
apostasy.question: Have you explicitly rejected God's existence, either through internal doubts or external declarations, in your thoughts and reflections about faith?
apostasy.description: Denying God's existence after having been baptized apostasy is one of the gravest sins possible because it is declaring the Author of Life and Source of all being to be non-existent, which directly contradicts both reason and divine revelation.

prodigality.question: Have I allowed excessive and wasteful gambling to take precedence over my family's financial needs, thereby risking resources God has entrusted to us?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

prodigality.question: Have I excessively risked financial resources entrusted to me, prioritizing indulgences over my responsibilities towards those in need?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

extracted_data_phrases: in ways that unnecessarily compromise my family 's financial stability
prodigality.question: Have I used resources in ways that unnecessarily compromise my family's financial stability, putting their well-being at risk?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.
